item.title: Neural networks as dynamical systems
item.description: tags Neural networks, Dynamical systems Neural networks can be seen as dynamical systems in different contexts. Recurrent networks With Recurrent neural networks, the continuous dynamical system analogy is very striking. These networks evolve progressively in time by updating an internal state with a fixed algorithm. Usually the state dynamics are not studied because the recurrent networks is designed to complete some fixed task. The notion of attractor can be defined for such networks, making them related to the notion of attractor networks.

item.title: Poincaré recurrence time
item.description: tags Dynamical systems The Poincaré recurrence time for a finite dynamical system is the maximal theoretical time after which the system will return to its initial state and the trajectory will repeat. In the case of a cellular automaton on a grid of size \(n\) with \(k\) possible states per cell, the recurrence time is \(t_P = k^n\).
